intro: Uapaca ferrarii, commonly known as the African cherry or red mombasa, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Uapaca ferrarii is also valued for its timber and has traditional uses in local medicine.
